items.sentence: Tom said he didn\'t think Mary could speak French.
We realize now that Tom knew exactly who Mary was.
We spent hours trying to figure out how to fix it.
We usually eat outside on the porch in the summer.
Tom didn\'t know exactly what was expected of him.
Tom didn\'t know how to treat his employees right.
Tom didn\'t tell Mary how much money he had spent.
Tom doesn\'t allow his children to play with Mary.
Tom says he doesn\'t want to be a janitor anymore.
Tom says he doesn\'t want to go to Boston with us.
Tom says he hasn\'t eaten anything for three days.
Tom says he will do it whether it\'s legal or not.
I forgot to give you what Tom gave me to give you.
I thought Tom would speak French better than Mary.
I wonder whether Tom can really understand French.
I wonder whether or not Tom asked Mary to do that.
I wonder whether or not Tom can understand French.
Do you honestly think I\'d do something like that?
Do you know of any way we can stop Tom\'s hiccups?
I copied a passage from the book into my notebook.
